Award.AwardTitle: NSF National Robotics Initiative (NRI) 2018 Principal Investigators Meeting

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will support the organization of the annual Principal Investigators (PI) meeting for the National Robotics Initiative (NRI), which was launched in 2011. The PI meeting will bring together the community of active NRI participants to provide cross-project coordination of intellectual challenges and best practices in education, technology transfer and general outreach. This activity will also establish a repository illustrating the research ideas explored and milestones achieved by the NRI projects.

The meeting is planned for two days in October 2018 in the vicinity of Washington DC. The format will include presentations by the attending PIs of projects in their final year, a poster session with all other projects, keynote speeches, and panel discussions.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award supported the development of the meeting program for the 2018 National Robotics Initiative (NRI) PI Meeting, while logistics for the event were supported by a separate award to Vanderbilt University. The meeting was held October 29-30, 2018 at the Hilton Crystal City in Arlington, Virginia, and was attended by 210 researchers.

The program was organized as five oral sessions for 39 projects in their final year, four poster sessions (for a total of 116 posters), and two keynote presentations. There also were opening and closing remarks and brief presentations from government agency representatives.

Information about the meeting was disseminated via the meeting website, https://cps-vo.org/group/nri-pimtg18. This website also provided forms to register for the meeting, to register posters for the poster session, and to upload PDFs of the oral presentations and posters. The oral presentations were recorded and links to the recordings are also available via the website.

An online survey was provided to all meeting participants and 35 responses were received. The responses were generally positive. For example, 70% of respondents provided an overall rating of "Very Good" and 30% rated it "Good", with none rating it "Fair" or "Poor". The only significant complaint from participants was about the Audio-Visual (AV) Services, where more than 75% were "Disatisfied" or "Very Disatisfied". This is based on extremely poor AV performance during the first oral session, due to technical problems that were corrected later that day. The survey also asked whether future PI meetings should be in the Spring or Fall. 21 respondents chose Fall, whereas 11 chose Spring. One comment in favor of a Fall meeting was that it would allow program officers to discuss upcoming calls for proposals.

The intellectual merit consisted of the dissemination of results from all active NRI awards to attendees at the meeting and, via the public website, to others in the field of robotics. The broader impacts included the opportunity for students and other young researchers to learn about a large portion of the robotics research in the United States. Furthermore, the website is public and therefore accessible to anyone with an Internet connection.


Last Modified: 04/02/2019
Modified by: Peter Kazanzides
